page.title: 04Life on Staple Farm
page.content: Mr Gibbons who farms{Staple Farm } likes to ride round his farm on {horseback}whenever he can. He says that you can see much more from the back of a horse than you can from a land rover or a tractor. He is a keen{conservationist}and being anxious to{preserve plants}and {wildlife for future generations.}He has{planted over 2,000 tress}since l976. There are at least nine areas on Staple Farm that have been carefully replanted. A wide{variety of trees}have been used including Oak, Ash, Chestnut and Sycamore. These have often been underplanted with a{Shrub Layer}of Holly Snowberry, Spindle, and Dogwood. In other corners of the farm areas {have been left to go wild}to encourage wild flowers and butterflies to come back into the farmland.
